Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
I’ve taken about 600 pictures with this “advanced” point and shoot and have mixed feelings.
On the plus side… The use of AA batteries is a huge convenience. The start-up time is pretty quick. The camera “knows” which is the bottom of the frame so that you won’t need to rotate the pics on your computer. The video and audio quality are quite good. The price.
On the minus side… The algorithm that Canon uses for its light balance and color saturation are not as pleasing as Nikon’s. The size is a bit bulky. The screen on the back is noticeably low resolution.
On the whole this is a camera full of compromises. We’re I to buy again I’d seriously consider the Nikon CoolPix S8100, but I’m not in a hurry to change over.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good solid camer with great zoom lens
Cons: Possible short battery life
I had been familiar with an older model of a Canon Digital camera and found this model to be an improvement. It has excellent picture quality and a better zoom lens than I had previously. It is bulkier than some of the slimmer models available, but I consider this a plus rather than a minus. The controls took a bit of study to figure out because they were different from my older one, but they are no more difficult once their operation is understood. I do miss the ability to look through a viewfinder as an alternative to the screen, but those seem to be phasing out industry-wide. It is very easy to download the photos to iphoto on my computer. As with most digistal cameras you have to buy a memory ca ... rd in addition to the camera. It operates with two AA batteries instead of the four my old model had and this may affect battery life. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Full manual control if you want it
Cons: Battery life; a little big
I am an amateur photographer that was looking for a Point & Shoot to take with me to family events trips to the museum, etc.
I got a Point & Shoot as a gift, and it was all well and good, but after awhile the amateur photographer crept out of me and I started wanting a Point & Shoot with more advanced-user features, like manual settings, manual white balance, manual ISO setting, etc.
A camera with those options is surprisingly hard to find, especially at a < $200 price point. In fact, this is the only one I know off.
It does an awesome job. The pictures come out fantastic, even in simple mode (a necessity for my wife), but if you're an advanced-user you will seriously ... appreciate all the manual controls, which even includes manual focus. No, manual focus does not work *great* but it's available. Also, the 14x Optical zoom is a nice option considering point & shoots lean heavily on digital zooming to save on space.
Bad News: Uses Double Freaking A Batteries. I almost returned it. But instead I went the other way, finally took the dive into LSD NiMH Batteries, and frankly, I'm better off. But using Alkalines on this thing will KILL you. Seriously, you need to get rechargeables, or at least get the Alkalines designed for electronics. This camera is murder on normal alkalines.
Anyway, once I got the charger I realized I can pack spare batteries (and the NiMH make the camera last comparable to "normal" cameras) plus in a pinch I can always buy normal AAs, like if I forgot to charge a spare pack. Heck, on a normal camera doing that would leave you unable to take pictures. At least I have a backup.
The other negative is that the camera is relatively bulky. I highly recommend holding it in person to get a feel for it. This is not a great camera for shoving in your pocket. It's quite large for a P&S camera.
I don't really take movies on them, but the quality seems pretty good. We have a separate camcorder, which we prefer because the audio is better and it can function ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: decent image quality for the price
Cons: slow, uses AA batteries
This camera is one of the worst cameras I have ever used. It uses AA batteries and only after 10 test shots and after 1 short video it started giving me a low battery indication. Seriously? I was lured in by the low price, but I won't make that mistake again.
Cons: -drains AA batteries quickly -clunky, heavy -flash has to be manually opened -flash has to Charge which causes a huge lag before your first photo and then between consecutive photos -stiff battery door -loud zooming noise. It can be heard when filming -slow to capture image -not compact enough to fit in pocket
Pros -image quality is nice but it's a slow process to get there. -has good macro potential. ... I am able to get very close to the subject. -the menus are easy to navigate -liked the designated EV control button. -video recording seemed fine -flash is of decent power when it's charged
Even for a hundred less on Black Friday it's still not worth it! I do think it might make a good starter camera for an old person.
If you're really on a budget though and you don't care that it's a slow camera or that it uses batteries.. you might like this one. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Use AA Lithium Batteries. I'm submitting these comments about the SX150, particularly in defense of its AA Battery Power source. I really hate to see a good quality camera (like the Canon SX series) get an undeserved bad rap because of misinformation. I've owned several Canon SX cameras in the past and I must say they've all performed very well. To be able to have a camera with both manual capabilities and AA battery power is a rarity and a real bonus in today's consumer market (especially when using AA Lithiums). Forget the alkalines that come with the camera. Those are typically throw away batteries???use them up and toss 'em. The next time you go to the store for batteries look for the AA Lithiums. I have been using the Ultimate Lithiums for a couple years now. They last about 6 to 8 ... times longer than your average alkaline and about twice as long as NiMH rechargeables. Yes, they cost about twice as much as alkalines but they're well worth it. You can get them anywhere, and they have a shelf life of 15 years, so they're always ready to go. Lithium AA's have changed the whole game. They standardize everything and just make things easier. So, for the sake of any perspective buyers out there looking for a camera, don't let the negative comments about AA batteries discourage you from a good camera like the Canon SX series. Battery life is the last thing I have to worry about with any of my SX cameras. In fact all my other high end cameras with their propitiatory batteries have a much shorter battery life than any AA battery camera I own. Not to mention all the different chargers that go with all the different batteries. Have you counted them all? What a pain, and what a joke. The only negative comment I have about this camera is that Canon has chosen to cave into consumer mega pixel hype and sliced its sensor up into 14 MP. Totally unnecessary. Twelve, or even ten, mega pixel was more than enough for the size sensor it has. Also, Canon, if you're listening, we don't need more mega pixels or interchangeable lens in a small pocket camera, just a bigger sensor. The next generation of pocket cameras should get a good boost in sensor size (not pixels). We're way over-due for that. Also, I believe any camera with manual controls and manual focus, like the Canon SX series, merits an LCD screen with at least 460k dots of resolution. We'd gladly pay the extra few bucks for it. That's what we want. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I've been on a mission to find a small (or small-ish) camera with good all around performance. I wasn't impressed with this camera when the flash was used. Day time shots came out nice, with the colors fairly true to life (maybe a touch on the dull side, but that can easily be fixed with image editing software)-- though when viewed at 100% the images look soft. Since I am probably not going to be printing things very large I'd have stuck with this if it were not for the weak flash, and how long it takes the flash to charge between shots. Sometimes I'd be waiting 10 seconds for it to charge, which kind of kills the moment if you're trying to get a candid shot of someone. I took a bunch of images inside with dim lighting, the flash should have, you know, lit things up, as flashes do, but ... if I was standing any more than 4-5 feet from the people I was photographing the images came out dull and were not nearly light enough-- they also had a yellowish hue. Other camera's I've had never had this problem. I could get decent pictures with a flash from across a room (as you often need to do with large group shots). I also took some pictures outside at night (of an opossum sitting still in my backyard that was maybe 5 feet away) using the flash and the images didn't look much better than pictures from a cell phone with a built in flash. When I didn't use the flash and just took low light shots they came out pretty good. A little bit grainy at larger size, but nice. If it wasn't for the weak flash I'd keep this camera-- but it's not nearly strong enough to make it worth keeping. I like the option of manual controls and it also takes good macro shots in bright light. Another con is that it eats up batteries like no tomorrow. The batteries it came with were drained within a few hours, and I took maybe 100 shots, max. Still, for this price, with the features this camera has, even with the short battery life I'd have kept it... but the flash! so weak. I'll be returning it today... The bottom line, if you're into flash photography, look elsewhere. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Packed with features that are easy to use.
Cons: Camera weight
I purchased this camera based on two facts. It has a 12 times optical zoom. It also uses regular batteries that are available in any store. People complain about the life of the batteries in other reviews. Considering this camera uses two AA batteries at a time, the battery life is quite reasonable. Since I shoot most of my pictures outdoors under sun light, I have no complaints. The features are great. As with any camera, there is a learning curve. I find the most useful feature is the stabilizer. It takes some practice getting use to , but once you understand it, it is easy to use. I highly recommend this camera. It won't fit in your pocket, but that's the price you pay for a long lens.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Camera with a Great Lens!
Item.Review: I just started using this camera over the past weekend, on a weekend trip to NYC. It performed wonderfully, in all types of lighting situations, and it has dynamite image stabilization. I used it on a ferry boat, on a very blusterday day (I was getting shaken all over the place), and almost all of my shots came out in sharp focus-- far better than with my previous digital camera. I took many shots through store windows (always a difficult lighting/glare situation, and I was very pleased with the results. I took a few video shots, and I'm overwhelmed with the sharp quality of the videos, in real HD. The camera has a large, sharp screen, and fits well in my hand; the controls are all within easy reach, even if I'm holding it in one hand. I'm still getting used to the layout (it's diffe ... rent from my previous camera). I will be using this camera for my work (construction inspection), so I'm hoping it's as solidly built as it looks (only time will tell). The only possible drawback to this camera is its weight. Some may think that this camera is a bit heavy or bulky; however, to me, it's worth carrying the extra weight/bulk, to have the fine lens that this camera has-- far finer than most other point/shoot digital cameras. This lens zooms to a wide angle comparable with a 28-mm lens (on a 35 SLR). It has 12X optical zoom, before switching into digital zoom. Most digital point/shoot cameras have really lousy optics-- not this one! It does not matter how many megapixels a camera features, unless the lens on the front is worthy. Although I haven't used it for but a few days, the camera appears to add much more to the battery life than my previous one. I purposely chose this model because it uses standard AA batteries, so I can have unlimited power while on the job. I can easily purchase additional batteries rather than being shut-down when the propietary battery runs down on the typical camera. This is my first Canon digital camera. I have used Canon SLR film cameras for many years, always with much satisfaction, so I hope this unit will perform just as well. So far, I'm much more satisfied with this camera than with my previous (Nikon Coolpix) model, which I literally wore out. I shopped extensively for a camera with the right combination of features that fit my uses . . . standard batteries, high-quality lens, sturdy construction, large LCD screen-- and I believe that I have found it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is my second Canon digital, and I have loved both of them. (First one (D10) was stolen right out of my car about 2 months ago.) My wife gave me this one for my birthday to replace the D10. OK, I did all the research for what to buy, so she's happy, as am I. The SX150 is easy to use right out of the box and comes with a digital user guide that is quite complete. Yes, I'd prefer a tree user guide, but I'm adjusting to having the digital one. The SX150 takes great pictures. The telephoto is awesome for a camera this size. I especially like the size and shape of the body. I have some weakness on my left side so I like having more camera to hold on to, especially in low light situations. Haven't really tried the video so won't comment on that right now. The controls are laid out ve ... ry well so it's easy to change modes, etc. Having the separate button for taking a video is a nice addition, too. The 16 GB card I bought from B&H will store something like 4200 photos at my usual settings. I will carry an 8 GB as a backup in case the 16 GB craps out. Cons--The flash could be stronger. I do like that you have to push it up manually, which the camera tells you to do when necessary. But it has a rather short range. Yes, it's tough on batteries. I have 4 Eneloops I've just started using and they do make a big difference. On the whole, the ability to use AA's is worth it IMHO. Changing out the batteries is easy so I don't really see this as an issue. In short, it's a buy! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Review:

Cons: Noise in low light, O.K battery life.
I just got this and replaced it with my Kodak C1550. I love the zoom, HD video, and all the effects. I have a very positive feeling about this camera. But, as in every review, short battery life. I put an O.K battery life because I made adjustments to extend the battery life. The noise, well, it isn't that bad as my other cameras, but the Discreet mode kind-of works. Now back to the positives. The manual lift flash is great because I know whether the flash is on or off, and the fact that you can adjust the power levels. Even though it's a smaller camera, it has the advanced modes like Manual (M), Shutter Priority (S, Tv), and Aperture Priority (A, A ... v). And I love all the color effects and the fisheye. Very little negative, but overall positive expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera has been the perfect fit for on the go shots instead of lugging around a DSLR. The picture quality is great and the 12X zoom has really been a nice feature. We take a lot of pictures of birds in the wild and the zoom on this really lets us get close without getting close. I also really like the size. As a larger person, the size fits my hands much better than the smaller compact P&S type cameras. The video quality is true HD and we really like the wind reduction feature for when we are taking videos while sailing. I would have gladly paid more to get this many features in a P&S camera. I have noticed other posts complaining about the flash. The specs list the range at about 9 feet so I don't know why they are complaining about the flash on subjects 20 feet away. Canon m ... akes a very inexpensive wireless flash that attaches to the tripod mount on the bottom of this camera. It has 3 levels of flash (which is really nice) or can be hand held (or positioned anywhere above, below, or to the side of a subject.) Order one from B&H along with this camera and you'll have a great little system that is easy to use and portable. We buy the Energizer Lithium AA batteries from [@] and use them in this camera, our other cameras, and our hand-held GPS and never have a problem with battery life. This camera does not come with even a small memory card so get at least 4GB and Class 10 if you can. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: 12x optical zoom
Long ago I quit using SLR cameras. This is my third digital point and shot type camera. It is replacing a Canon Power Shot SD 770IS that is starting to sometimes blur photos. This Canon has many more options available, I really like the smile feature, it's saved a number of photos. My first major use will be a Hawaiian vacation. Some people dislike this camera because it does not use rechargeable batteries. I consider it a plus because I don't need to tote a charger and AA batteries are easy to find. It will just fit into my pants front pocket. So far I only dislike the way you navigate the menu but I guess it will get easier with use.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great picture quality, fast shutter reaction
Cons: battery life
This camera is great. Has tons of great features, is easy to use (aren't all Canon's?) Picture quality is AMAZING, but it sucks batteries. I ran into the same problem with my old Canon Powershot SX, but thought it was because the camera was getting old (had it for 6 years). Turns out it must be Canon itself. I can't even get through one "event" without the low battery warning flashing. And I'm not using it for anything wild and crazy. Just point and shoots of the family while out and about. I'm gonna try some of the batteries specifically for electronics and see if it helps at all.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Not intended to be a replacement for a dslr this straight-forward point and shoot is great at what it is. It has a long zoom, competent modes and solid picture quality for what it is. Some may wish for a smaller body but it fits well into a jacket pocket and you'll want the extra gripping surface to hold it steady on those long shots.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I haven't had a Powershot camera before. All the many great features made this tempting. But within 4 hours of opening box the orig. batt's were used up, with very little vid time or shots fired (no flash either). The images aren't as breathtaking as I'd hoped 14 MP would be, moving from my 6 MP Digital Rebel (maybe the difference in glass). I shot a good video of a band in the shade that came out well, w/ good stabilization too. Tried to shoot a 2nd angle wedding vid Hi Def, balcony view, w/ new batt's, new tape. Hit record and it lasted 23 minutes before stopping (batt's). Will probably keep as 2nd vid backup; zooms well during recording. For it's cost it's good except for alkaline batt's drained dead so quickly. Screen not easy to view at all angles or if sunny.

I have love my Canon cameras in the past, and I was really excited about purchasing this camera. The camera takes great photos, lots of features, and excellent zoom. However, it seems to deplete the batteries very quickly, especially with video. Even lithium ion batteries don't last long.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, clear photos, program options
Cons: very slow inbetween shots
We bought this camera for my daughter to take photos on a recent trip to Ecuador. In some areas of the capital, we were advised to not use our DSLR, and this camera still gave us terrific photos. The big drawback is the lag between photos, very slow. We had read several reviews prior to purchase about the lag, but still made the purchase anyway. The other features outweigh the sluggishness of the camera. My daughter loved the fisheye lens feature and took several amazing photos using it. Great camera for a beginner or someone that needs a smaller camera to keep in their pocket.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I needed a new camera for my wife and wanted something I wouldn't hate using (I use a Canon 7d DSLR). I love the large crystal clear LCD on the back. THe zoom is impressive and the size is compact for a camera with this kind of feature set.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great auto-focus, even extreme close-ups, even in automatic mode!
Cons: Time between shots could be quicker.
Selected this camera based on a few quick tests in the store. Took a distance shot of the far side of the store on full zoom, and was able to read text in the signage. Then held the camera literally one inch in front of the display card and snapped a picture, and it was crystal clear. We have been using this camera to snap pics of birds at our feeders, and have not been disappointed!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Outstanding picture quality, very easy to use
Cons: Shiny screen surface can sometimes make it hard to shoot outdoors
I'd been very happy with other Canon products, but had never actually tried their cameras despite it being one of their core products. I was wary of not having a viewport at first, but the picture quality on the LCD is fantastic and very accurate for what you're shooting. Response from the shutter and zoom are both excellent, and picture quality is the best I've experienced. The manual focus takes a little getting used to, and I wish there was a way to keep it in that mode between camera timeouts, but it's easy to get back to that mode. I didn't factor video into my purchase at all, but the video capture (and stabilization while doing so) was a great sur ... prise bonus. My only complaint (and it's a minor one) would be how shiny and fingerprint-prone the LCD screen can be, as it can sometimes be an issue in heavy sunlight. Even with that, I would not hesitate to buy this camera again or to recommend it to anyone. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I own and love a PowerShot SX100, and was considering an upgrade when this SX150 came up on sale for <$170 on B&H... couldn't resist. Same great menu system and suite of presets that I love in the Canon PowerShot line, AWESOME zoom, great low-light performance, and the upgrade to 14MP and 720HD video. I was sold. The optics are just unmatched with anything but a DSLR. Got it in time to take on my trip to Panama, and loaned my SX100 to my travel buddy, so I got to see them perform side-by-side... both are great cameras. CONTRADICTION: I like the overall size compromise because it's still pocketable if you're wearing loose clothes like cargo pants or shorts, yet it performs nearly as well as a DSLR if you know how to max out the features. BUT... the right side hand-molding is a li ... ttle too small; I find it hard to grip firmly with my big hands. STILL FAR BETTER THAN A TRUE POCKET CAMERA, THOUGH. The SX100 had a little better hand feel. Not an issue if you have average size hands. Love the middle-of-the-road design and the feature/performance/price matrix is unbeatable. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: good value
This was an upgrade from a cheap Nikon- love the ease of use, large screen- yet compact enough to carry in a pocket. We also choose this for it's use of AA batteries- we keep a good supply of re-chargeable NiMH's and can always buy regulars if we're stranded somewhere.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good Starter Camera, Great for the Price
Item.Review: This is a good camera for someone who thinks they may want to get into photography but are not ready to invest in a pro model. Allows user a full range of adjustable settings. Picture quality is comparable to some higher end cameras. It is pretty hard on batteries but that is its only downfall. I see where others have complained about the flash that does not pop up automatically. I do not see this as a big issue. How hard is it to flip it up with your finger? This can't be beat for the price.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Stop yer whining, it's a good deal
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent value, and takes great pics if you understand it's strengths
Cons: Low light noise, slowish flash recharge
I should start off by saying that I am a diehard Canon fan, I have been using and enjoying their cameras for a long time. As far as the SX150 is concerned, Canon has done a good job creating a product that is focused on giving the average user the most features and usability for the least amount of money. This is a value camera, in a nutshell. I would agree that it is a bit lower quality than previous comparable Canon products, but so what? Most users do not need to pay the big bucks for a cutting edge piece of technology. This camera is not cutting edge, but it is definitely a nice camera. It takes excellent pictures if the light is reasonable. The only ... pic quality problem I see is that there is definitely a noise issue in low light situations with this camera. You can really see it indoors, in low light. Just look in the shadows, there is more noise than I'd expect for a 2011 camera. So, I would not highly recommend it for indoor use unless the lighting is at least okay. The flash does a good job of eliminating the low light problems and giving a great picture, but I try to avoid flash pictures as much as possible. Just personal preference. The flash is painfully slow on recharge, not a big issue for me as I will not be relying on the flash for this camera in how I intend to use it. Potential indoor problems aside, this is an excellent outdoor camera for the average person. The 12x optical zoom is awesome! I took some pictures of birds flying to see if there was a blurr issue and it's not that bad. It's better than I had expected, seems like it performs very well to me. I think blurr problems would be worse indoors and with the a lot of zoom in use. It takes pretty dang good video too, and is not the battery hog that some people would want you to believe. The fact that is uses AA batts is one of the primary reasons I love this camera. I have an Elph300 and one of the reasons I bought this camera was so that I could replace my previous AA camera with a newer model, ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Price and Brand
Cons: Zoom, Action Shots
I purchased this camera going on Canon's Reputation and past Canon Products. I had the model just before this one, and had to exchange it after a problem occurred with the SD Card Slot.
This camera is JUNK!!! The Video did not work on the one I got. The pictures are VERY blurry! The zoom... is just horrible! My wife took our daughter to Disney On Ice... and the pictures turned out horrible, and she is disappointed to say the least.
Forget ANY kind of action shot!! Any kind of small movement, and the picture is blurred out terribly. When you zoom in, 10x's worse!
I returned it and purchased another brand.
I would NOT recommend this camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have had previous versions if this camera and the thing that I love is the control that you can have on your images. The manual flip up flash is great, as is the flash output control, so you can pop and drag with shots outside in the evening and really have lots of fun, As for the 'problem of AA batteries', I prefer AAs over proprietary batteries, because no matter where I am, I can walk into a corner store, a grocery store or a gas station and buy batteries, without having to worry about having a charger and missing out. I bought one of these for my mother, to take with her while traveling in southern Europe with some friends. They kept telling her that she needed a camera with a lithium battery, because they last so much longer etc. But when their batteries ran out, they missed any pic ... tures for the rest of the day, when this happened to my mother, she walked into a store and bought new batteries without worrying about it and continued on taking pictures. This is not a camera that fits in your shirt pocket, but it will allow you to play and have great camera control for a fantastic price. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great quality
Cons: Long refresh on the flash
This camera takes great pictures. The quality of the pictures when zoomed in all the way (48x) is unbelievable considering the price of the camera. It's super easy to use, too.
Only complaints are that it eats batteries pretty quickly and it does take forever for the flash to recharge. But those are small prices to pay.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Smaller, lighter-weight backup for the Canon SX30, which won't fit in the video accessory baggie. 12x optical zoom is useful for all but extreme close ups. Gotta love the Positive Film setting! Alkaline batteries drain in the blink of an eye, so get some rechargeables.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Macro - close up pictures are great and very detailed
Cons: the flash can be improved... alot
This camera is used for work taking detail pictures of assemblies and electronic components. Using it for the past month has already paid for itself. Excellent macro and low light quality of this camera has made me look like a pro. The camera is so easy to use and this is great when you are in a hurry to take a picture no extra buttons or anything to take up time. Yes I would buy it again.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, good price
Cons: Short battery life
My family specifically purchased this camera for a vacation we took to South Korea. It is great because it's size makes it easy to handle and use. As mentioned by many others the battery life is to be desired. We found this out the hard way when we did a 8 hour day of sight seeing and taking photo's. Be sure to have extras.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera as a step up from my compact digital in order to take pictures abroad. I love being able to use the different features, such as the fisheye, and the auto takes good quality pictures. The zoom works very well and still results in quality pictures. Personally, I hate flash photos so the fact that you have to manually open the flash does not bother me. However, take ten flash photos and there goes your battery. If you want flash photos, this is not the camera for you. I bought long-life batteries but I still have to make sure I have at least one extra set with me when I leave the house. It is definitively bigger than the compact but easily fits in my purse and is easy to carry around. For traveling, this has been a great companion, especially in countries where charging i ... t would be a challenge. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good price & great pictures
This is a great camera. A little technical; still haven't figured out all the functions. However, it does take very sharp & clear pictures.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted a quick focus, fast shutter camera that would take good shots of my two Siamese cats at play. The price was right, and my blurred cat photos are history.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Returned in less than a Day!
Item.Review: I only had to use this camera for a day to know that it's a horrible choice for anyone. Main reason - the Flash takes up to 12 seconds to charge I've never seen this in ANY camera I've owned, even super cheap cameras from years ago. While it's charging you can't do anything, not even change settings and to make matters worse, the flash isn't even all that good. The picture quality is only so-so, the shutter lag is ridiculous, I kept missing the shot I wanted between shutter lag and flash charging. I returned it after 2 hours of dealing with this.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera, battery life could use improvement
Item.Review:
Pros: Features, great price, picture quality
Cons: Battery life
This camera was meant to replace a Canon PowerShot SX30 IS, which while it has a better zoom and better picture quality, is extremely bulky and a pain to carry around on vacation, which is where we would primarily use a camera besides our iPhones. This camera takes great pictures and the zoom is great for the size. It is a lot less cumbersome to handle than the SX 30 IS. My only complaint is that batteries will maybe last for a couple hours and 100-150 shots (and we weren't leaving it running the whole time, we'd take 10 shots or so, turn it off and 20 minutes later turn it back on). It's disappointing because it's rated for 320 shots. It dies very fast. We are going to try some high capacity rechargeables, so at ... least we won't be buying new batteries constantly, I also have some hope that the Powerex or Sanyo Enveloop batteries will last longer. But overall, great for the price! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Love the picture quality
Cons: The battery life stinks!
I bought this camera because my wife wanted a camera that would use regular batteries so they could easily be replaced on a vacation or what not. Well the down side is that those batteries go down very quickly!
I also have the eye-fi card with it and don't know if that can cause battery drainage. The eye-fi card is very nice. I love it and wont go back on that.
I will be returning the camera even though I thought it took great pictures and really enjoyed all the features of the canon. Most likely I will get another canon camera, just with the rechargeable batteries.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: This camera is easy to use, easy to upload pictures. Have not had any battery issues so far. Still using the ones that
Cons: So far so good!!!
Coming from a Kodak easy share, the Canon is awesome! The pictures are so much brighter and clearer. The price is right. Actually came up at the register for $129.00 and not the sale price of $149.00

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Slow to recharge, less features than SX100is
Item.Review:
Pros: Smaller size than SX100is, large screen, 14.1 megapixels, 12 x zoom
Cons: Flash slow to recharge, uncomfortable to hold
After taking a flash photo, the wait seems incredible before you can take another photo. Even after taking a shot without a flash, it is slower than any other camera I have used. It is frustrating to loose shots waiting for the camera to be ready. I bought this camera to replace the Canon SX100is that I dropped and damaged. I thought this was an upgrade to that camera, but I was wrong. The Canon SX150is has less shooting features and doesn't have a grip on the right side for a comfortable hold, like the SX100is does. I could live with the grip and the fewer features, but the camera is just so slow to recharge. Don't buy this one.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera almost a year ago. Takes good pictures, nice features. except now the camera won't read the memory card at all. I tried different cards and it still won't read the memory card. Something is wrong inside of the camera...it was good while it lasted...

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Biggest issue is the wait time for the flash. Nice crisp photos. Nice video shots. Uses AA batteries which is handy. Invested in the Lithium and they lasted much longer than standard batteries.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Love the picture quality but battery....
Item.Review: Love the picture quality and ease of use but i seem to keep running low on battery more quickly than i would expect. I am going to try the specific batteries recommended again, the third batch I put in were just AAs because on vacation and had to buy what I could find, but even the digital camera quality seemed to run out quickly. But the camera has been wonderful, the pictures look great in all settings, indoors, outdoors and even at dusk. so far so good as long as i keep a stash nearby.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I was looking for the following features in a camera: affordable, easy to carry for travel, great pictures, and some control over settings and such. The PowerShot SX150 fits my needs perfectly. I've only had it for a few weeks and already the quality of my photos has improved.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Happy with features, have had canons before so I like the controls. It is a nice size for holding, especially for the wife, you don t feel like you are about to drop it like the smaller models. I like the 12x zoom and even though its an older model (advantage great sales) it has all the features I want. It does use 2 AA batteries and the life could be longer, you just have to have an extra set close by, just like I do with the rechargeabe one because they die at the most inopportune times.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Bought this camera for my father. He has been using it to take pictures at family gatherings and other social gatherings. It's been pretty easy to show him how to work it. The camera is a little bulky for a pocket camera---but we wanted it that way so he would be able to grip it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use; good price
Cons: a little bigger than most digital cameras
I bought this camera primarily for personal use. I didn't realize how many extra features it had until I started using it. The picture quality is amazing! It is very easy to work and the zoom is awesome. This is probably the best camera I've owned in a while!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Do any of you know how to use a camera ?
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: It wasn't free :)
This is a fine little camera for the money. I call it my pocket cam which is what I use it for. I would assume from some of your reviews that some of you don't know much about taking good photos. There is no such thing as pick it up, turn it to ( Auto ) and get a great shot every time, if you do not understand how to work in the ( CREATIVE ZONE ), you have no business working with a camera, and I have never used anything but Canon cams and will not be switching anytime soon, the following shots have been done, with zoom in use I may add, with this little handy tool called the SX150 and if you have a good SLR, and a advanced point and shoot like I do, then this is your great choice for a pocket cam for the days when you don't wanna lug ... around bigger gear expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I gave this camera as a gift to my 11-year old daughter. She is thrilled, the camera is easy to use, has many features and functions, and takes great images. The only con is that standard AA batteries have a very short life. Using Lithium AA's makes a big difference, they are more expensive but last much longer, and in the end you will save money using the lithiums rather than the standards.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Easy to use point and shoot! We have several cameras and this one takes great pictures on the fly. It has the capability to change settings so you can be creatIve too.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is the second time that I have bought this camera. I bought it before I traveled to Germany this year. When I bought it I had the extra warranty for accidental handling. I took it to Germany and a few other places and got some of the best pictures that I have ever had. I was impressed. Very high quality. The camera also takes great HD video. It was almost as amazing as the photos. A few weeks after I returned to the states I dropped it and I sent it back to the company. They sent me a check and I bought this camera again.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good for a novice in photography
Item.Review:
Pros: good quality for price
Cons: Could come with a rechargeable battery pack
I was a little skeptical to buy this camera at first; I bought it on black Friday (11/25/2011). IM glad that I did, this is an awesome camera for any beginner who eventually plans to move into an SLR camera, or if you want good quality photos. I toyed with it when I got home, and loved it, I highly recommend reading the instruction manual that comes with the software (I know most people don’t) but do you will learn how to use all of the features that this product has to offer. I like the fact that although it does offer a good optical zoom the digital one is good as well the photos do not come out grainy. Picture and video quality are great; I like how it fits in my hands, and the good sized 3” LCD ... screen. Over all I was really impressed with it and I highly recommend it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality
Cons: Batteries, Heavy, Flash
Was really excited when I saw the quality of depth of the pictures. On waterfront- you could see the water ripple. That was it.- the battery cover was a problem-returned camera. The new camera-no matter what batteries- rechargeable -AA- I can only get about 10 pictures for the batteries.
I have always had Canon's and love them. Features sounded great but can't get past just being able to take more than 10 shots without changing batteries. It is back into the dark ages, having to raise the flash.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Glad this camera is still around
Item.Review: Good all around point and shoot and I just bought my second one. Not easy to find a good camera that can do most everything and still runs on AA batteries! When in the field for weeks with no charging, having a AA battery camera with a zip lock full of batteries is great. This is also a good way to back up a larger DSL camera. You never want to go all that way and miss the shot.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to Use, Good Picture Quality, Uses AA Batteries (No charging)
Cons: Flash needs to Charge between pics
This seems to be a fun little camera. It was a fair price for an everyday camera and i like that it uses AA batteries so it's never a problem for it to die in the middle of a long day of sightseeing or when you forget it was dead from the last time....just replace the batteries and go!
It does bother me a bit that the flash needs to charge between pics so it delays being able to continue shooting when you need the flash, but I can live with that since the camera was priced right and doesn't require charging the battery.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A very good camera, and easy to use.
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent resolution, great video.
Cons: No external mike input
All is very good with this camera, but unfortunately as for video, Canon is not exempt from the ubiqitous, nonsensical tradition of other camera manufacturers who boast of high quality, HD video capability, but don't include an external mike input. So now you can film perfect HD video complete with exquisitely-recorded camera noise. Yes, the manual does warn of this, advising you to make your visual settings in advance, but what the hell is the problem with simply adding an external mike input? Hello? Anybody home?

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera and easy to use.
Item.Review:
Pros: Love the magnification .
Cons: Not wild about having to use batteries.
This is my 4th sure shot Canon camera. The first was stolen at Budget Rent A Car in Los Angeles, I gave the 2nd to my son, the third was knocked off into the trash by my cat, and now have the present one. I love it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: great camera to carry around; clear pictures
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to use; small; great zoom; lots of pixels for clearer pictures
Cons: super short battery life; I went through 20 batteries on a 12 day trip to Europe,
My pictures were the best ones and there were three other people taking pictures on our trip. Everyone commented on my shots being so clear; plus, I was the only able to zoom in on far away objects. My camera was about the only one that also worked during illumination tours. The only glitch was that this camera ran through batteries; had to stop and constantly buy new ones. Buy a battery charger!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: MOV video format is a big negative
Item.Review: I love the price and 12X optical zoom. But I just found out that it takes MOV video. That means I can't put it into PowerPoint or Camtasia, which is what I mostly do with video. What a shame!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Simple to use
Cons: Camer is toooo slow between pictures
The sales person had alerted me that this camera would not be as fast as a competitor camera. I chose this one for the large icons and ease of navigating the icons. I still like that feature. But after taking it to events, I realize now the "slow" is really really slow. The flash takes at least a minute to reset. The pictures take almost 45 seconds to reset. So many photos opps were missed :(

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent quality for the price of the camera!
Item.Review:
Pros: There are so many features on it that I didn't even know it had!
Cons: Nothing really.
Wasn't sure about getting this camera until the guy at the Best Buy store should me all the things that you could do with it! I'm glad I definitely got this camera for the price it was!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: It takes fast pictures which is great for me because I have 2 kids and they are constantly on the go.
Cons: The one thing that I miss is being able to plug in my camera and let it charge over night for a full day of pictures.
I really enjoy this camera and i think it takes great pictures. It's deffinately better than my older camera because it takes pictures faster and I don't have to wait and worry about missing the shot. However the one thing that I do miss is have the rechargable battery. I don't like that I keep having to replace batteries. I liked when I was able to plug in my camera and take pictures all day.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Really a good camera for grand kids and vacation
Item.Review:
Pros: So easy to use and to get the hang of the settings
Cons: Only thing wrong is the battery life.
I had this camera only a few weeks now but i have taken lots of pictures of my grand children and great grand children, i have not had a bad picture yet, it is so simple to use and as far as the batteries go i just bought longer life batteries and rechargeable ones. This is the really the best camera i have had so far.Don't care to much for the manual flip up flash but it's not bad once you get used to it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good picture quality
Cons: the focus moves around a lot
I had few issues with this camera. One being that when you zoom in, the focus doesn't stay still (though that might be just because I used it when I was moving).

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: My mom ordered this about 2 weeks ago and she was very satisfied with the product. T I got to play with it too and it takes awesome photos! We really like it. I told my mom that I want one too :) Thank you for your service!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted something with a good zoom, but could not afford a professional camera. this camera has it all, for the price. i took it whale watching and zoomed right on the whale. its not as light weight as a pocket size camera but still fits in my purse/pocket.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Amazing Camera, Best I've ever had!
Item.Review:
Pros: So Easy to Use, Takes amazing Pictures!
Cons: Keep extra Batteries on hand!!
I used to think that having a battery operated camera would be a pain...however...ever go out, needing your camera, then it dies on you??? And you can't just recharge your dead battery?? That's what's so great about this camera. Just pop in fresh batteries and you're good to go!! :D Love it Love it LOVE IT!!!!!!!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is comparable to others in it's field for a cheaper price. If you are looking for something reliable to do the job this is it. Great features all around.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Camera, very easy to use.
Item.Review:
Pros: Quality pictures.
Cons: camera needs new batteries to quickly.
Very good camera, zoom is good, takes great pictures. The only problem is the camera needs new batteries to quickly.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Canon's digital photo quality can't be bested at this price
Cons: Would have preferred a single rechargable lithium battery like our former Canon
Bought this camera to replace a smaller Canon that still works fine but did not have the features or zoom capability that this one has. Plan to use it a lot on our trip to Alaska this Summer. While it'e not perfect, it has all the capability that most users need to get great photos. Battery usage is best handles by buying good rechargable AAs and a good charger.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: EVERYTHING
Cons: NOTHING
AWESOME FOR A BEGINNING PHOTOGRAPHER. OUTSTANDING IMAGE QUALITY! EASY TO HANDLE
EATS UP REGULAR AA BATTERIES MUST! MUST! USE RECHARGEABLE ( NiMH BATTERIES ) FROM EITHER 2300mAh-2500mAh
I WOULD ALSO RECOMMEND THE ENERGIZER - 15 MINUTE AA BATTERY CHARGER
Chargers batteries in 15 MINUTES! PHENOMENAL RAPIDLY READY TO SHOOT. YOU WILL ALSO HAVE A EXTRA PAIR OF BATTERIES WITH YOU. AS BACK UP BECAUSE THE CHARGER COULD CHARGE 4 AA BATTERIES AT ONCE.
WOULD LAST ABOUT A FULL DAY IF USED NON-STOP.
http://www.bestbuy.com/site/Energizer+-+15-Minute+AA+and+AAA+Battery+Charger/4721073.p? GOD BLESS

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is the best camera for the smallest most compact size. I love that I can put this in a jacket pocket for traveling. This is my third, and they keep getting slightly better. Am not sure why the +/- ends of the batteries were flipped in this edition. Petty complaint for such a great workhorse of a camera. Still love it!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Takes good pictures
Cons: Slow, what's with the manual flip up flash, eats batteries for breakfast, snack, lunch, snack, dinner, & midnight snack
Camera takes good pictures but is a bit slow between shots. The manual flip up flash is a bit of a pain to deal with. We have an A810 that has a much better set of features/functions than this sx150. You may want to purchase stock in Duracel before buying this camera. Bought this on Black Friday because of the price ($150) but ended up taking this sx150 back, not worth it to me.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera on Black Friday, but did not take the time to throughly review it. I quickly found out how fast this camera goes through batteries. I have to change the alkaline AA batteries almost every time I use the camera. With the flash, new batteries lasted less than 25 pictures, and without using the flash, new batteries lasted about 60 pictures. No even close to the "Approx. 110" shots using Alkaline Batteries as listed in the manual. The picture quality was ok in medium light without the flash, but I expected better. I'm doing everything I can to save the batteries, but this camera drains them too fast and will end up costing a lot more in batteries, and worse, if you run out of batteries and don't have a spare set for the "perfect" picture.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great point & shoot, my back-up camera
Item.Review: I use a Canon Rebel DRL camera as my main camera, but lugging around a big camera bag is not always practical. I use the Powershot SX150 as my light and fast camera. I keep it in my car so I always have a good camera close at hand, and it's so simple to use and produces great shots for a point and shoot. I like that it uses AA Batteries because you can always get some no matter where you are, but I recommend getting Lithium Batteries, as it will consume regular batteries prett quick.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: The good, the bad but No ugly
Item.Review: 1st: This camera is almost 100% perfect for what I was looking for. Lots of features in a point-and-shoot to please any semi-professional photographer - at less than $200. But -> If you're not willing to put up with having a manual pop-up flash and needing an ample supply of back-up batteries on-hand than you should steer clear of this camera. There's nothing ugly about this camera though. I prefer not using flash so the pop-up feature is not a problem - it's a blessing! As far as the batteries go...I use rechargables and always have extras with me....so this is no big deal either...it should be noted that there is no CONSTANT battery icon...it ONLY flashes when they get low....that's kind of annoying!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I've been a fan of the Canon PowerShot Digital cameras for years now. They take great photos which everyone raves about and it is easy to use and portable. This years model is even more powerful than ever. The menu options on the wheel are fewer and have changed a bit, yet it only took me a few trials to figure out how to get the same great effects I had with previous models.I just wish they had left the action setting on the wheel for high speed photography. It still takes action shots, but when set in the P function. The zoom is as good as it gets in a handheld digital.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great for point & shoot picture taking
Cons: Takes too long between shots
I had the older version of this camera, and when it was broken I decided to buy the newer version. Mistake....the picture quality doesn't seem the same as my older one. When taking pictures, the recovery time is terrible (takes way too long to be ready for next shot). And when taking the picture with flash, it takes several seconds for the picture to take. Returned the camera and am looking for another make/model.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:

Cons: short battery life
I had to purchase this item to replace a defective one. While it was inconvenient that the original camera had a failure, the workmanship and reliability for almost a year was great. I only hope this one lasts longer. Canon cameras are great, my previous one lasted 5 years until my grandson threw it overboard. LOL

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Bought a Sony with Zeiss lens because I had one before and couldn't beat it...gave it away (stupid) and a few years later went looking for another...big disappointment...then purchased this camera from Canon, took it home and was quite impressed with the quality of images. A note on battery life...one shouldn't complain about alkaline battery life, they last no time in any digital camera so expect it. Buy some niMH rechargeable batteries and have extras on hand. For the person who trouble with their camera saying it would no longer read the card try low level formatting it, it says this in the manual included with the camera. Overal a great little camera.
